summary: The document is a training report detailing a program designed for indigenous personnel focusing on paramilitary resistance and intelligence collection in denied areas. It outlines the course's emphasis on practical work and field exercises, accounting for 70% of the training time, with the remaining 30% dedicated to theoretical aspects. Performance evaluation is conducted on a scale ranging from Unsatisfactory to Exceptional, with tailored criteria for each level. A student named FRANK is specifically noted for his hard work and high level of achievement, receiving a 'highly proficient' rating despite minor practical shortcomings. The report also mentions adjustments to the standard rating scale at the request of JMWAVE, indicating a customized approach to evaluation within the program.
key_findings: The training program prioritizes practical work and field exercises (70%) over theoretical learning (30%).
Performance evaluations are based on a detailed scale from Unsatisfactory to Exceptional, with specific criteria for each rating.
FRANK is recognized for his diligent attitude and high achievement level, achieving a 'highly proficient' rating despite some practical inaccuracies.
The evaluation criteria were modified at JMWAVE's request, showcasing a bespoke assessment framework for the program.
